\subsection{Detailed Description}
scale a robust kernel to another delta (window size) 

Scales a robust kernel to another window size. Useful, in case if one implements a kernel which only is designed for a fixed window size. 

Definition at line 41 of file robust\+\_\+kernel\+\_\+impl.\+h.

compute the scaling factor for a error\+: The error is e$^\wedge$T Omega e The output rho is rho\mbox{[}0\mbox{]}\+: The actual scaled error value rho\mbox{[}1\mbox{]}\+: First derivative of the scaling function rho\mbox{[}2\mbox{]}\+: Second derivative of the scaling function

\begin{DoxyCode}
51 \{
52   \textcolor{keywordflow}{if} (\hyperlink{classg2o_1_1RobustKernelScaleDelta_a4a2976cb5f12553f0e00dfdf239b1231}{\_kernel}.get()) \{
53     \textcolor{keywordtype}{double} dsqr = \hyperlink{classg2o_1_1RobustKernel_a4b03953a6e7bfca64efea37fb98548aa}{\_delta} * \hyperlink{classg2o_1_1RobustKernel_a4b03953a6e7bfca64efea37fb98548aa}{\_delta};
54     \textcolor{keywordtype}{double} dsqrReci = 1. / dsqr;
55     \hyperlink{classg2o_1_1RobustKernelScaleDelta_a4a2976cb5f12553f0e00dfdf239b1231}{\_kernel}->robustify(dsqrReci * error, rho);
56     rho[0] *= dsqr;
57     rho[2] *= dsqrReci;
58   \} \textcolor{keywordflow}{else} \{ \textcolor{comment}{// no robustification}
59     rho[0] = error;
60     rho[1] = 1.;
61     rho[2] = 0.;
62   \}
63 \}
\end{DoxyCode}
